intro: Sisymbrium longisiliquosum, commonly known as the long silique vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces elongated, slender pods called siliques, which are typical of the mustard family. It typically blooms with small, yellow flowers in the summer months. Sisymbrium longisiliquosum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides.
